section.para:
The auditor gathers audit evidence that the broker-dealer has implemented the controls described in and that those controls are operating effectively. The auditor then identifies the objectives for the audit of assertions about financial instruments and financial instrument transactions and designs related procedures: paragraph 8.23
The audit evidence can be obtained a variety of ways, such as a type 2 service auditor’s report or special procedures performed by the broker-dealer’s internal or external auditors.
In and , the auditor concludes that audit risk can be reduced to an acceptable level without identifying controls placed in operation and gathering evidential matter about their operating effectiveness. In this scenario, however, the auditor concludes that identifying broker-dealer controls over the existence and completeness assertions and gathering evidential matter about their operating effectiveness is necessary to reduce audit risk to an acceptable level. The only difference in the nature of substantive procedures is that in this scenario, analytical procedures are the only procedures performed to determine whether all the securities that Lane owns and all its securities transactions have been recorded. However, in and , reconciliation procedures are also performed. scenarios A B scenarios A B

entry.para: The recorded securities exist, and Lane has the rights and obligations associated with ownership of the recorded financial instruments.

listitem.para: Confirm with the broker-dealer the name of the investee, the number of shares, whether the shares are pledged, and that Lane is the owner.

entry.para: The recorded financial instrument transactions occurred.

listitem.para: Inspect supporting documentation, such as trade confirmations or entries in the broker-dealer’s monthly statements.

entry.para: All the financial instruments that Lane owns and all its financial instrument transactions have been recorded.

listitem.para: Perform analytical procedures on dividends and realized and unrealized gains and losses.

entry.para: The financial instruments are recorded at their fair value, determined by following the requirements of FASB ASC 320.

listitem.para: Obtain the per-share price quoted by the exchange at the balance sheet date and compare the quoted price with the price that Lane used.
Test the extension of the number of shares at the quoted price.

entry.para: Realized and unrealized holding gains and losses are properly reported as earnings or other comprehensive income.

listitem.para: Evaluate management’s considerations in ensuring that the requirements of FASB ASC 320 were satisfied.

entry.para: The financial instruments are properly classified.

listitem.para: Gather audit evidence about the classification of the financial instruments as available for sale.

entry.para: Disclosures about financial instruments and financial instrument transactions are adequate.

listitem.para: Read the financial statements, and compare the disclosures about financial instruments and financial instrument transactions with the requirements of FASB ASC 320-10-50.
